message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and exam findings suggest that the patient has cholecystitis, which is inflammation of the gallbladder. The most likely cause of the blockage is a stone lodged in the cystic duct. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) cystic duct.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms, especially the pain radiating to the right scapula and inspiratory arrest during deep palpation of the right upper quadrant, suggests cholecystitis or inflammation of the gallbladder. The blockage would most likely be caused by the cystic duct, which connects the gallbladder to the common bile duct. Common hepatic duct would cause obstructive jaundice, Ampulla of Vater would cause pancreaticobiliary obstructions, and pancreatic duct of Wirsung would cause pancreatitis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The location of the pain and the tenderness to palpation in the epigastrium, with inspiratory arrest during deep palpation of the right upper quadrant, suggest the most likely diagnosis is acute cholecystitis. The cystic duct is blocked due to a gallstone, causing inflammation and pain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The epigastric pain that radiates to the right scapula along with tenderness to palpation in the epigastrium suggests cholecystitis, an inflammation of the gallbladder. The fact that the patient experiences inspiratory arrest during deep palpation of the right upper quadrant suggests that the cystic duct, which connects the gallbladder to the common bile duct, is likely obstructed. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) cystic duct.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The right upper quadrant tenderness and inspiratory arrest during deep palpation suggests cholecystitis, which is caused by a blockage at the cystic duct. Common hepatic duct blockage leads to extrahepatic cholestasis, Ampulla of Vater blockage leads to biliary colic, and Pancreatic duct of Wirsung blockage leads to acute pancreatitis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and exam findings suggest that the patient may have cholecystitis, which can be caused by a blockage in the cystic duct by a gallstone.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and examination findings suggest acute cholecystitis, which is most commonly caused by a blockage of the cystic duct by a gallstone. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) cystic duct. Common hepatic duct obstruction may cause jaundice and elevated bilirubin levels, which are not present in this case. Ampulla of Vater obstruction may cause pancreatitis or bile duct obstruction, also not consistent with this patient’s symptoms. Pancreatic duct obstruction may cause pancreatic duct dilation and pancreatitis, which are not seen in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The location of pain, especially radiating to the right scapula, and the meal history suggest acute cholecystitis, caused by blockage of the cystic duct. Common hepatic duct blockage will cause jaundice. Blockage of the ampulla of Vater will cause pain in the epigastrium and can lead to jaundice as well. Pancreatic duct obstruction can cause pancreatitis, which manifests as mid-epigastric pain that radiates to the back, and also involves elevated serum amylase and lipase.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest gallstone disease and the tenderness in the epigastrium with inspiratory arrest on deep palpation of the right upper quadrant suggests acute cholecystitis. The cystic duct connects the gallbladder to the common bile duct and is the site where the majority of gallstones become impacted, causing obstruction and ultimately leading to acute cholecystitis. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) cystic duct.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The pain and tenderness in the epigastrium with radiation to the right scapula and inspiratory arrest during deep palpation of the right upper quadrant suggests cholecystitis, which is most commonly caused by obstruction of the cystic duct. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) Cystic duct.
